body:
+1

Given this is a mirror from the official Git, am I wrong to assume this is not getting merged?
This is just a mirror. They will never merge anything from here :-1:
Looks good to me.
I think this is a useful addition, however I don't have enough maven plugin knowledge to fully review the patch...

I was running the Aries Blueprint tests and noticed that it needs access to [mvn:org.junit/com.springsource.org.junit/4.4.0], which is not included in the listed repositories in the parent pom. 

In any case, when I add that in as a dependency, the test still hangs as below. Are you getting this too?

`<error message="Cannot get the remote bundle context" type="org.ops4j.pax.exam.spi.container.TestContainerException">org.ops4j.pax.exam.spi.container.TestContainerException: Cannot get the remote bundle context
    at org.ops4j.pax.exam.rbc.client.RemoteBundleContextClient.getRemoteBundleContext(RemoteBundleContextClient.java:324)

    java.net.ConnectException: Operation timed out
    at sun.rmi.transport.tcp.TCPEndpoint.newSocket(TCPEndpoint.java:601)

Hmm, no, I have nice:

I spotted that I had `~/.m2/repository/org/junit/com.springsource.org.junit/4.4.0/com.springsource.org.junit-4.4.0.jar`, but when I removed it the tests were still ok (and the artifact was not downloaded again.

btw, you can chat me at freenode/#apache-aries

regards
Grzegorz Grzybek
It seems related to the fact that I was using Java 6... With Java 7 it works for me...
Great ;)
@grgrzybek please close the pull request if satisfied.
Please close the pull request if satisfied.
We are trying to get pull requests merged. However, I'm not familiar enough with the JPA area to properly review this pull request. Maybe someone else can provide a review?
This pull request is merged. Please close the pull request if satisfied.
Ah yes - because of the wildcard, I didn't spot that as it wasn't on the diff.
Apologies, that comment referenced the wrong pull request. It closes #7 instead. So much for the manual steps in getting this back into SVN :(
Thank you!

The pull request was applied in http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=revision&revision=1583301 - sorry put the wrong pull request in the commit message.

Please close the pull request if satisfied. (I am not able to close it).

Hi Markus,

When I run `mvn install` with your changes I'm getting a lot of errors:

```
Running org.apache.aries.plugin.esa.EsaMojoTest
Tests run: 8, Failures: 0, Errors: 6, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.614 sec <<< FAILURE!

Results :

Tests in error:
  testBasicEsa(org.apache.aries.plugin.esa.EsaMojoTest)
  testBasicEsaWithDescriptor(org.apache.aries.plugin.esa.EsaMojoTest)
  testBasicEsaWithManifest(org.apache.aries.plugin.esa.EsaMojoTest)
  testSubsystemManifestGeneration(org.apache.aries.plugin.esa.EsaMojoTest)
  testSubsystemStartOrder(org.apache.aries.plugin.esa.EsaMojoTest)
  testArchiveContentConfigurationSubsystemContentBundles(org.apache.aries.plugin.esa.EsaMojoTest)
```

Before I can merge the pull request these errors need to be fixed (they're clean on trunk). It would also be great if you could add an additional test for your changes.
Close as per https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARIES-1165?focusedCommentId=13964141&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-13964141
I've added a failing test case on https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARIES-915. Can you verify this is indeed an issue?

I verify the test case and the code does what it should do. When configuration factoryId "blueprint-sample-managed-service-factory" is used no updates will be made ​​after the initial creation (the default update strategy is "none"). See also the comment in test case "test1".

When the configuration factoryId "blueprint-sample-managed-service-factory3" is used, it works fine. Here is the update strategy "container-managed".
Is this pull request still relevant or can it be closed?
I guess it can be closed as the underlying issue is fixed https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARIES-1038
+1. The auto-generated stubs should be there?
Thanks Cristiano, I've applied your patch in commit 1621690. Maybe you can close this issue if you are happy with it (I am unable to close it).
David, could you please push to the subsystemsR6 branch too ?
I'm not sure what the state of that branch is. It might be better to ask this on the Aries dev list.

I do not really understand why you are using an additional PersistenceContextProvider. You only explain here what it does but not why. Can you perhaps open a jira issue for it and explain what is wrong/bad at the current solution and how you solve it?

In this pull request there are two smaller solutions that seems to be separate:
https://github.com/ggerla/aries/commit/35b4a04f5d3ae192013b5e48c4605af221316746
https://github.com/ggerla/aries/commit/21511b10a3c9664592b96d09491a418bb27e5cc6
I think I can already commit these if you want. Does that make sense?

Yes you are right: there 2 different problem. 
The first one is that explained in ARIES-1023 and ARIES-1079. This issue is solved with commit 
https://github.com/ggerla/aries/commit/35b4a04f5d3ae192013b5e48c4605af221316746

I open ARIES-1295 for the second one.

Hi Maxim,
I will look into the pull request over the weekend. One question about the JTA 1.2 Transactions. Were you able to test them in karaf? When I last tested this I had the problem that I was not able to find bundles of the JTA 1.2 API. The API also does not seem to be self contained so it probably needs more than one bundle to work.
I found the necessary bundles in the test code. That is good news. If the merge and tests work for me I am very positive for this pull request.
Thanks for the pull request. I was not able to apply it as I got lots of conflicts ... not sure why as it should be fine from what github says. So I just did the dependency upgrade in the end.
Hi Christian, I will close this pull request, I see you have changed the version of transaction.blueprint dependency.
Fix not sufficient. See remarks in JIRA.

Hi @rgilles,

Could you please file an issue in the Aries JIRA for this too and reference this pull request from there? 

Thanks!

Hi,
Do you want a bug or an improvement?

Romain.
Ok, I use a bug type. Following the ticket: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARIES-1437
Is this pr still valid? I think we already have jpa 2.1 support now. Btw. Sorry for not looking into this earlier. I just got familiar with pull requests in the recent months.
This should be done already I guess can I close this?
This is already done.. will close.
This is already done. Will close the pr.
I think this issue is already fixed now. Can I close the PR?
Hi Giuseppe. The issues seem to be solved. Can you close this PR? I will try to do it with a commit but not sure if this works.
This seems to be applied. Can you close this PR?
Can you add a jira issue for this. If it is only in github PR it gets lost easily.
This PR seems to be fixed. Can you close it?
Sure, sorry for not doing that earlier.
No problem and thanks for your contributions.
This is not applicable for the current trunk anymore. If you resolve the conflicts I will review.
it is already available in Blueprint Core since 1.4.4  - https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARIES-1319  :-)
I will close this PR. Please reopen if it is still relevant.
Applied the PR can you check and close it?
Applied the PR can you check and close it?
Applied the PR can you check and close it?
Applied through SVN. Thanks!
Applied through SVN. Thanks!
Applied through SVN. Thanks!
Merged in SVN
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARIES-1501
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARIES-458

Most of the code looks good but there are two things:
- We can not simply introduce lombok. This would require a discussion on the dev list. For example in my eclipse the project did not compile anymore. So if you want to introduce this then you need to get backing by the aries community first. 
  As for this case the improvements in lines of code is not that big I propose you rewrite to plain java. At the same time you can start a discuss on dev of course.
- Your commits do not reference the issue. Please always use a commit message like "[ARIES-1501] your text"

Hi,
I have removed lombok and I have added issue reference to commit message.
Merged mannually by @cschneider in https://github.com/apache/aries/commit/218954f09e8728ac5610e5352e634b1b0d3a31b5
Merged to trung in https://github.com/apache/aries/commit/aeab80c35e5014b7627546fa3dcaca94f6d8b040
Reviewing ... It looks good so far.
Reviewing and testing.

Was this one resolved with https://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=revision&revision=1741981 ? 

@johnpoth if so could you please close the pull request? Normally this is done automatically with a comment, but it looks like that didn't happen this time...
I have applied the PR. Can you check and close if it is fine?
This already seems to be set now. Can you close the PR?
It is fine.
Great that you did a PR for this bigger change. I almost missed it though. Can you open a discuss thread on the dev list so we can also get feedback from others?
Can you squash the commits into one. That makes it easier to review.

I have written an email about this PR when I have created PR. It was in the same thread, in which github has sent information about PR.

I will squash the commits and send the email one more time.
The commits are squashed and the email was sent
After a quick review the spi change looks pretty good. I am sure there are improvement points but nothing that should hold a merge from my point of view. Lets give it some time for others to comment.
There is no more comments, so I close PR and merge it to trunk
Merged in https://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=revision&revision=1750823
Please, add license comment to each new file.

If not done already, the deletion of the temp directory will also need to be addressed. Using the InputStreamCloseableDirectory is not sufficient. I suggest creating a new implementation of ICloseableDirectory and returning that from UnpackingFileSystemImpl.getFSRoot(InputStream). The cleanup() method would invoke org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.deleteDirectory(File) or the copied and properly attributed code.
About the copy .. if java 7 also covers that case I think using the Java 7 method is better than copying. ... or is it important that we stay on java 6?
We have at least some contributors and consumers for whom switching to Java 7 is not an option.
Then +1 for copying with correct attribution.

Changed my own recursive deletion implementation to copied code from Apache Commons IO. 
For all code that was copied I referenced their github codebase, the license and a reference to license itself.
+1 for getting this branch merged as it speeds up a lot.
R: @jbonofre
Merged, can you close this PR please ?

@alien11689 @jwross @cschneider @tjwatson @bosschaert 

I included the contributions of @tjwatson in the pull request (thx!). Secondly, I moved all filesystem code to aries-util. 
1. A defect identified by @tjwatson had to be fixed in aries-util
2. Not including the code in Aries-Util led to unit test failures due to incorrect imports and since we were touching util for the bug fix it seemed better to put the code where it belonged.
   This does make ARIES-1565 dependent on a new release of util.

This is giving me a successful build of both subsystems and util.

Suggestions/contributions are welcome :)
I merged the fix into aries SVN.  Thanks.  I'm unsure why I cannot seem to close this pull request.
Who can make a release of aries util?
@tjwatson I can't find these commits on the trunk of aries on this github mirror. Sure you merged it into aries SVN?

@alien11689 @jwross @cschneider @tjwatson @bosschaert this pull request is no longer needed when the changed from ARIES-1612 are used instead (see https://github.com/apache/aries/pull/55). An equal performance boost is obtained there. As the changes are less complex we would opt to include that pull request in a new aries utils release. Who can make that release and merge the changes into trunk?
The fix is in trunk.  See: http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/aries/trunk/util/util-r42/src/main/java/org/apache/aries/util/filesystem/impl/ZipFileImpl.java?r1=1760753&r2=1760752&pathrev=1760753
@tjwatson thx, what is the differnce between the util-r42 and the util directories? Which of the 2 is part of the next release? @bosschaert can you provide a new util release including this change?

My understanding of the two directories is that they both are use to create the util bundle.   But the r42 one can be used to create a util bundle that can run on a R4.3 framework.  This is likely obsolete and the two folders should likely be combined.
Should the change then be applied in both directories?
Thank you for your contribution:)
